summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an attorney named Jeff, discussing coordination to speak with a witness (referred to as 'she') in the Epstein case. The email involves multiple parties from the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.context: The recipient of the email, representing a witness ('she') whom the prosecutors wish to interview in connection with the Epstein case.

persons.name: Special Agent M
persons.context: An FBI agent who had been in contact with Jeff and passed along his contact information to the prosecutors; copied on the email.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working on the Epstein case in the Southern District of New York, seeking to arrange a call with Jeff to discuss interviewing his client.

connections.description: Special Agent M had been in touch with Jeff and passed along his contact information to the prosecutors.
The prosecutor is emailing Jeff to coordinate a call regarding interviewing Jeff's client, a witness in the Epstein case.
Jeff is representing an unnamed female witness ('she') whom the prosecutors wish to interview.
Both are working on the Epstein case; the prosecutor copied the FBI agent on the email.

events.title: Prosecutor Reaches Out to Witness's Attorney
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails attorney Jeff to arrange a call about interviewing his client, a witness in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Southern District of New York were actively seeking to interview a witness in the Epstein case as of December 2019.
The witness had previously spoken briefly with FBI agents but then referred them to her attorney, Jeff.
The email indicates coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI in the Epstein investigation.
The identity of the witness is protected, referred to only as 'she' and represented by counsel.
